definition: cause and effects (idiom); entire process of development
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
cause/reason/because
back/behind/rear/afterwards/after/later/post-
fruit/result/resolute/indeed/if really

sentences.english: Nine younger sister listen to happy old man say that finish context, immediately agreed.
sentences.chinese: 九妹聽神醫老人說完前因後果，立即點頭答應。

sentences.english: After careful investigation，he got to know the ins and outs of the accident.
sentences.chinese: 經過仔細的調查，他終於弄清了事件的前因後果。

sentences.english: The play the causes and effects of logical relationship is roughly such.
sentences.chinese: 這齣戲的前因後果邏輯關係大致是這樣的。

sentences.english: We need to understand the context in which these accidents occur.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須瞭解這些事故的前因後果。

sentences.english: German health authorities are currently investigating the circumstances around infection in the confirmed case.
sentences.chinese: 德國衛生當局目前正在調查確診病例感染的前因後果。

sentences.english: We should seek settlement in the context of that incident.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該根據這一事件的前因後果尋求解決辦法。

sentences.english: Cause and effect, or use FVF software for condition monitoring.
sentences.chinese: 的前因後果，或者利用FVF軟件進行條件監控。

definition: the content of a conversation/words/remarks
to consider past cause and future effect (idiom); to think over the past and future/to ponder over reasons and connection
to turn pale with fright (idiom)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to keep silent
to make a big fuss over a minor issue (idiom)
stupefied/flabbergasted
words do not convey the meaning/poorly expressed/senseless/inarticulate
to abandon/to forsake
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
human face, beast's heart (idiom); two-faced/malicious and duplicitous
depressed/sulky/moody/unhappy
inside information/the ins and outs of the matter/how things stand/what's up
to criticize (as a matter of principle)
to make insinuations/to take an indirect approach (in making inquiries) (idiom)
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
